news_header: European Parliament approves €35 billion loan to Ukraine.
news_text: The European Parliament has voted to provide a €35 billion loan to Ukraine to aid in its defense against the ongoing Russian conflict. This loan is part of a larger G7 package totaling $50 billion, agreed upon in June. Repayment may be facilitated through additional revenue from frozen assets of the Russian Central Bank. The Committee on International Trade has overwhelmingly supported this package, which has also received backing from the council, with plans to disburse payments to Ukraine next year.
